definition: first of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/(used for an unspecified person or thing)/first (in a list, as a party to a contract etc)/letter "A" or roman "I" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/armor plating/shell or carapace/(of the fingers or toes) nail/bladed leather or metal armor (old)/ranking system used in the Imperial examinations (old)/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)/ancient Chinese compass point: 75°
Mengjia (also written Monga, Monka or Bangka), the pre-Japanese-era name for Wanhua 萬華|万华[Wan4 hua2], the oldest district of Taipei

sentences.english: The title refers to one of Taipei oldest areas.
sentences.chinese: 电影片名“艋舺”取自台北一个古老城区的名字。

sentences.english: And yes in the Manka neighborhood there is less crime then in the other regions of the city.
sentences.chinese: 艋舺一带的犯罪率的确比其他地区低。

sentences.english: The title refers to one of Taipei's oldest areas.
sentences.chinese: 电影片名“艋舺”取自台北一个古老城区的名字。

definition: see 土魠魚|土魠鱼[tu3 tuo1 yu2]
variant of 羹[geng1], used in restaurants and night markets in Taiwan
round basket used for feeding the cattle
load/cargo/old variant of 載|载[zai4]/to transport/to deliver/to bear/to support
